utterance.speaker: NYPD OFFICER
utterance.content: Emma Riggs, open the door!

utterance.speaker: NYPD OFFICER
utterance.content: We hear you moving around in there! Open up!

utterance.speaker: NYPD OFFICER
utterance.content: 33 David to Central requesting immediate backup. Possible homicide suspect, white female, brown hair, fleeing down southwest fire escape.

utterance.speaker: NYPD OFFICER
utterance.content: Stop her!

utterance.speaker: SUE WILLIAMS
utterance.content: Excuse me, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Are you asleep?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why’d you answer me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sleep talking. Also known as somniloquy. Just ignore me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know what to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have some ideas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle, I’m talking about my life. I don’t know what to do about my life. I haven’t been out of work since I was 15. I cannot believe that the FBI fired me and I can’t get my job back at the NYPD because of the Commissioner’s stupid hiring freeze. I might as well just apply to become a mall cop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. You would look great on a Segway. You know, Beckett, you don’t have to decide right away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle, what are you saying? What am I going to do? Just sleep in every morning and screw around until the phone rings? What kind of life is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just mean that, you’re with me now. You don’t have to work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t need to work? Does that mean you’re my - sugar daddy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Hold on. That didn’t – come out th– actually, I’m still sleep talking. I can’t really be held responsible for whatever I say.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Wow. Even when you’re fighting you two are super cute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pi.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Morning Mr. C, Mrs. C-to-be. Hey, do you mind if I borrow a razor? Alexis gets all fired up when I shave with the one she uses for her legs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under –

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: - the sink. Yep. Cool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why is he still sleeping on your couch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Good morning darlings!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t anyone knock?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Door was open. Don’t be an old maid. Nothing going on here that I haven’t seen and done before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how can I help you, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: As you know, my studio is being painted, so I am having my stage combat class in the living room in – ooh, 15 minutes. So please, feel free to join us.

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Triple blade razors. Nice, Mr. C!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I think I’m going to sleep at my old place tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I might join you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: What is this, a house meeting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Captain Gates is on the phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She’s asking for you – Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Thanks for coming, Mr. Castle. You too, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Again, I’m sorry your reinstatement didn’t work out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks. So, what do we got?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Angelo Vazquez, stabbed to death in his girlfriend’s apartment. And this is Mr. Vazquez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you are calling on my expertise to unmask the killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, actually we’ve already ID’d the suspect. She’s the victim’s girlfriend, Emma Riggs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know it’s her?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Because she fled from the scene and took hostages in a dental office up the street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so this involved me how?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Hostage negotiators have been trying to talk to Emma, but she’s demanding to speak to only you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me? Why me?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We were hoping you could tell us. Is she familiar to you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … I’ve never seen her before. What do we know about her?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not much, so far. Emma Riggs, 31, waitress, no record. At least until now. Sergeant? This is Sergeant Roman from the Hostage Negotiating Team. Richard Castle, Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, Deputy Chief. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: SERGEANT ROMAN
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, are you open to talking to Emma over the phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. Anything I can do to help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s the situation inside?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: It’s not ideal , for our purposes. The windows in the office are covered and there’s only one door leading in or out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can’t you just drill in fiber optics?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Cement’s too thick. But we have ascertained that she’s taken five hostages. The dentist, Dr. Abe Kogan, his receptionist, Sue Williams, patient Mickey Gerhardt, and Suki Chung, who’s nine years old, and Suki’s mother, Lisa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a nine year old in there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What … what if I say the wrong thing?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: I’ll be with you the whole time. We’ll make contact, see how everyone’s doing, take Emma’s temperature. See what she wants. And we’ll put a plan together. All you have to do is talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if there’s one thing you excel at, Castle, it’s talking.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: You ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but let’s do this anyway.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, Emma. This is Richard Castle. I heard you wanted to speak with me.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: How do I know it’s really you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, well, if you care to step outside I’d happy to show you my driver’s license.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Okay, you say you’re Richard Castle, you’re going to have to prove it, all right? In the ‘Nikki Heat’ series, what’s Rook and Nikki’s wine of choice?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sancerre.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: In Deadly Heat what’s Douglas Sandman’s nickname?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bedbug Doug.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: In Storm Rising what’s Pierre DuBois’s last words?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, trick question. Pierre was a Trappist monk. He took a vow of silence. He never spoke. Boom! Believe it’s me now, Emma? Because I could play Richard Castle trivia with you all day. I will crush you.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Okay. It’s you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So let me ask you a few questions –

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. Not on the phone. The cops are listening.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: So I don’t trust them, okay? Just come inside the dental office and we can talk here.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY GERHERDT
utterance.content: You’ve got to be kidding.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Hey! Shut up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, look, Emma –

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: We need to speak face to face. Do you hear me? It is the only way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but only if you send out Suki and her mother. Deal?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Deal. Be outside in 5 minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: God, Castle, what the hell were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no idea. Honestly, I didn’t think that she would take the deal, but look, she’s a fan. I know my fans. She won’t hurt me.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: You don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not blind to the risks, but I already got her to give up a little girl and her mother. I can reach her, all right? Maybe even get her to surrender. So let me go in.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: The goal is to get in and get out, you understand? Get her demands, check the status of the hostages, and make mental notes of where everyone is. That’ll help us if we have to breach. You with me so far?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Demands, status, mental notes. Got it.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: And if anything, and I mean anything, seems off, tell Emma that you have to call us. Tell her it’s to make sure that we’re not going to do anything stupid, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: So we’re going to need a code word that tells us that you need help. What uh - what’s your favorite food?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, um … are we talking everyday food or fine dining? If desserts are included there’s this –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cheeseburgers. He loves cheeseburgers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do enjoy a good cheeseburger.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Okay. Anything goes wrong, call, mention cheeseburgers, and we’ll come running. Good luck in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheeseburgers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, I’m kind of looking forward to spending the rest of my life with you, so … don’t do anything stupid in there, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, don’t worry. I think I already hit my stupid quota for the day.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Oh my God. It really is you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we have a deal?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: C’mon. C’mon! Let’s go. Come in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’re you guys doing?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: How do you think we’re doing?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I told you, shut up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Emma, Emma, easy. I’m here now, all right? So let’s talk. You want to tell me your demands?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: What do you mean, demands?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … money? Transportation out of here?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No, no, I don’t want any of that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, then what do you want?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: You. I – I just want you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want me?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: My boyfriend is dead. And I know what it looks like, I do. It looks like I killed him. But I didn’t kill him. I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma! Please, stay calm.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I know what you’re capable of, Richard Castle. How you solve murders. You want demands? Okay. I want you to prove my innocence.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: So she wants you to prove her innocence?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. So I hate to break it to you, but I don’t think this is going to be a traditional hostage negotiation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s read all my books. All those articles about you and I working homicides together.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So she’s your number one fan and this is some sort of hail Mary?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pretty much. So look, I think we should –

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Don’t tell them anything else!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Because. They’re cops.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Is everything all right, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m fine. I’m just going to talk to her and then I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. No cheeseburgers. I repeat, no cheeseburgers. Cutting down on red meat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we do now?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: We wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But I –

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: But, what?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, are you sure that this woman doesn’t have a record?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because she seems to have a deep mistrust of the police.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, obviously there’s more to her than what’s in the system.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know I’m not on the job anymore, but –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You want to work the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It can’t hurt to have an extra pair of eyes. And the more we find out about Emma, the better chance we’ll have at getting Castle and the hostages –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, Emma. You didn’t kill your boyfriend. Let’s figure out who did. As you know, all my stories start in the same place, the beginning. So tell me what happened.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I got home late last night –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did you get home late?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Well, after work I, um, I bought a dress. Because today’s my birthday, you know. Angelo was, uh, was going to take me out to dinner tonight. He – he worked out some sort of surprise. Said it would be a birthday I’d never forget.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea what the surprise was?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: A marriage proposal? At least, that’s what I was hoping. That’s why I bought the dress, even though I couldn’t afford it. Just … stupid, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not at all. So you have your dress, and?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: When I got home I poured my nightly two fingers of scotch –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A scotch girl. Me too. Well, boy. And then what happened?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: When I woke up in the morning I – – I found Angelo on the floor, dead. There was so much blood, it was – - but I don’t know what happened. I – I – I don’t even know why Angelo was at my apartment in the first place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did you do?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I panicked. Tried to get out there, and the cops came, and … Here I am.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Yeah, holding us a gunpoint. Talk about psycho girlfriends.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: What did you say?

utterance.speaker: SUE
utterance.content: Are you trying to get us killed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay, Emma. Relax. Ignore him. Just focus on me. All right. Did Angelo have a key to your place?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you didn’t make any plans for him to come over last night.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How were things going in the relationship? No problems?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Uh uh. Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How much scotch did you have?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: One glass. The two fingers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Now I’m going to need you to walk me through this again.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Girl, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … Captain Gates said that I could come.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s not what I meant. Shouldn’t you be off looking at wedding venues or something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, we haven’t even set a date. We’re just trying to enjoy our engagement. Why is everyone trying to rush us?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Think you’re being rushed now, wait until after the wedding. Not ten minutes from the altar they’ll all be like, ‘when are you two having a baby?’.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, your wife’s hormonal because she’s pregnant. What’s your excuse?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, I take it this is Emma’s boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was, until she stabbed him three times with a knife from the kitchen butcher block.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emma’s claiming that she’s innocent. Is there any chance that someone else did this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No foreign fibers or prints. All evidence is pointing toward Emma.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any ideas on motive?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh yeah. This is Angelo’s cell phone. Check out the text history between him and Emma. She was accusing him of having an affair with some chick up in Scarsdale.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we found this in Angelo’s pocket. “S.H. off of Sawmill River Parkway”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sawmill River Parkway is the way to Scarsdale from the city.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: S.H. could be the initials of the lady he was seeing on the side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And listen to this, Emma texts Angelo last night at 9:47 last night saying she’s drunk, lonely, and wants to see him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And here is an empty bottle of scotch. Ladies and gentlemen, this is a booty call gone wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This doesn’t make any sense. I mean, if she actually killed him then why isn’t she asking for a flight out of the country? Why is she insisting that she is innocent?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, maybe because she’s crazy. I found Emma’s prescriptions: clonazepam and aripiprazole. Lanie, aren’t those anti-psychotics?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: One is. The other’s for mood disorders. Hey, you know if Emma stopped taking her meds she could have had a psychotic break.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means she wouldn’t remember what she did. We have to warn Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett, relax. He’s just on the phone with the woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. He went in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh. Okay, let me call you back.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Did Detective Beckett find anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma, I can’t help you if you’re not honest with me.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: But I have been honest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said everything between you and Angelo was all right.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Yeah, it was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you didn’t suspect him of cheating?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No, it’s just - that he kept going up to Scarsdale without saying why. I’m sure it was nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you? Or could it be that you wanted to confront him. And maybe that’s why you texted Angelo last night and invited him over.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: What are you taking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at your phone, Emma.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Wait, I don’t – no, I don’t remember writing these texts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just because you don’t remember doesn’t mean you didn’t. Just like you only remember having one glass of scotch. But what if you had more? They found your scotch bottle, Emma. It was empty.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I didn’t finish the bottle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you did and you just can’t remember.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: That is ridiculous!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma, you wanted me to uncover the truth.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No. Not you. Please don’t tell me that you don’t believe me. I didn’t kill Angelo, okay? I mean, I wanted to marry him. I wouldn’t do this! Oh God. God. Did I? What if I did? I don’t –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you text ‘love you’?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you write ‘love you’, how do you spell it?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I do a sideways heart and the letter u.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, except for last night when you just spelled it out, ‘love you’.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No. Uh uh. I never spell it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and the voice in those texts from last night, it’s – it’s different from the others.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: As if somebody else wrote them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe. I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Well, if I didn’t write these, that means that somebody else did, right? Which means the killer used my phone.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: You have to dust this for prints. C’mon. C’mon! You have to find the killer.

utterance.speaker: KOGAN
utterance.content: You’re not leaving us, are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m – I’m going to get you out of here.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Like hell you are. Look, if you and the cops aren’t going to do anything I sure as hell am.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Shut up! What are you waiting for? C’mon! Just go, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mickey, don’t do anything. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, what happened? What is going on in there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve got problems. Emma is unstable, to say the least. But that’s not the worst of it. There’s a hostage in there, he’s seen Die Hard too many times. He’s going to try to be a hero. And there’s something else I think you need to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma might actually be telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The truth about what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I think she’s being framed for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But what if Emma is right? What if someone else wrote those texts and this is all just an elaborate frameup and Emma’s just a patsy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Syntax, bro? You’re going to base Emma’s innocence on how she writes her texts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, it’s possible.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, if we found DNA or prints or fibers at the crime scene, maybe.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sully, we get a useable print off Emma’s cell phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To use her phone without her knowing, Emma would have to have been unconscious. So … someone could have knocked her out. She has a scotch every night. Someone could have dosed her bottle.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Or maybe she’s just some crazed fan, like Kathy Bates in Misery. You should be happy you didn’t get hobbled. Right?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, this is your investigation. Keep running the case on Emma.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain, I’m –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ah, let me finish. Look, Mr. Castle, over the years I have learned not to discount your little theories, no matter how fanciful. So why don’t you and Beckett work with Detective Sully and let’s see if there’s something to this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: So, where do we start?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By looking into our victim, Angelo Vazquez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything here tells the same story. Angelo was a decent guy. Ten years ago, after some petty B and E’s, he turned his life around. He volunteered with at-risk youth, he was well liked. He had been recently laid off from his mechanic’s job, but he was still upbeat. There’s nothing that explains who killed him or why, other than Emma.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you’re forgetting about Scarsdale.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think Emma’s suspicions are true? That he was having an affair? That some woman in Scarsdale killed him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, something was going on in Scarsdale. Look at this. Three nights ago a resident complained about Angelo’s car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does Sully find anything on this desk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. He must have a system. I think that was once a bagel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? Here we go. A Scarsdale resident on Overlook Road reported Angelo’s license plate to the police. He said the driver spent … … two hours drinking coffee, alone, in his car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two hours drinking coffee alone doesn’t sound like much of an affair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what was Angelo up to? Beckett.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Sully. There was nothing of interest at Angelo’s apartment, but his car is a whole other matter. Get this. Angelo had a duffle bag filled with tools of the burglar variety, a floor plan to what looks like a house, and a manual for a Ramco 4700 alarm system. I don’t think he was installing home security systems.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Angelo was out of work. Do you think he went back to committing B and E’s?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I only know one person with the answer to that question.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Okay, here’s the plan. Doc, act like you’re having a seizure.

utterance.speaker: KOGAN
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: And then Sue, squeeze out a few tears, beg Emma to help him, and when she does, boom. I take her out. We end this, and then we meet at the bar around the corner and the first round is on me.

utterance.speaker: KOGAN
utterance.content: Are you out of your mind?

utterance.speaker: SUE
utterance.content: That is the dumbest plan ever.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Fine. Then I’ll do it by myself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. And I brought doughnuts.

utterance.speaker: KOGAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Um, gluten free?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dude, they’re doughnuts. Either you’re in or you’re out.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: You find out anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma, what do you know about Angelo’s trips to Scarsdale?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Nothing, he wouldn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible he was there casing a house for a burglary?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: What? No. That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do the initials S.H. mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could someone from Angelo’s criminal past have come back?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Wait, that was all petty stuff when he was a kid. That’s all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he wasn’t a kid anymore. The stakes were higher. He was out of work. He wanted to surprise you on your birthday. Maybe propose. What if he got into trouble trying to make that happen?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s not in there, is he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We found something. Something about Emma.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma. Let these people go. Okay? It worked. You got my attention. There’s hope now.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No. Uh uh. Not until my name is cleared. No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Beckett. I’m –

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do not react to what I’m about to tell you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emma has been playing you this whole time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Interesting. Can you elaborate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Angelo is not her first victim. She’s done this before. She has a sealed juvie record under her original name, Emma Jones.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When she was 16 she killed her foster brother, Billy Kaas. Apparently she got drunk, lured him into their basement, and then stabbed him with a knife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Also known as an MO. Castle, it’s exactly what she did to Angelo. She’s unstable. You need to get out of there. Now.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Don’t say another word. Hang up.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: She told you about Billy Kaas, didn’t she?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, Emma –

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Back up! I am not a murderer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Says the lady pointing a gun at me.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: You weren’t supposed to find out about Billy. I mean, what is the point of a sealed record when the cops can open it whenever they feel like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure they got a subpoena first.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: And I’m sure they all had a laugh at all the adjectives describing me, right? Manic, bipolar, violent, murderer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not to be a stickler, but murderer isn’t an adjective.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I’m not an idiot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. I get sarcastic when I’m nervous.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: That’s not what I was talking about. I knew what you were going to think. Two deaths happening the exact same way? That’s why I didn’t tell you. But I’m innocent! I didn’t kill Angelo, I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If that is true Emma, and you want me to help you, you have to tell me everything.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: When I was 16 I was sent to this foster home. Twin orphans lived there. The Kaas brothers, Warren and Billy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Those two bullied me for weeks. Foster parents were in it for the money, so they didn’t care. But then one day the twins were nice to me all of a sudden. You know, I thought they, um … I thought they finally accepted me, you know? So we – we went down to the basement and drank schnapps and then … Billy pulled a knife on me. I was just trying to stop him. I didn’t mean to. And when the cops came Warren lied. He said I pulled the knife on them and they just – they just took him at his word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why you hate cops.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I didn’t kill Angelo. I didn’t. You have to believe me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do, Emma. I believe you. But why were Angelo and Billy’s deaths staged exactly the same way?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I have no idea. I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It has to be someone who knew something about your past.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, I guess so. But who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Warren Kaas. What better way to get revenge for the death of his brother than by killing your boyfriend and pinning the murder on you?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No, it’s not Warren. Warren’s doing eight years up in Sing Sing for assault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You kept track of him?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Of course. He’s the reason I changed my name. I mean, I have been really careful about staying off of Warren’s radar ever since he testified against me in court. He almost got me thrown in prison for life. If it wasn’t for the sisters of Saint Helena’s Home for Children, I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Go back. Saint Helena’s Home for Children. Where is that?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: In Yonkers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The note we found in Angelo’s jacket said “S.H. off Sawmill River Parkway”. S.H. has to be Saint Helena’s. Yonkers is off Sawmill River Parkway. Somehow Saint Helena’s is connected to this.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: But how? I – I haven’t been back there in years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I spoke with Sister Francis at Saint Helena’s. She said there was a break in three nights ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And they have a Ramco 4700 alarm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ramco 4700. That’s the manual Angelo had in his car.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Why would he break into my old orphanage?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We have a pretty good idea. Sister Francis checked the records room.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And Emma’s sealed foster care file is missing. Looks like Angelo stole it.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: But why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To find out something about you.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: No, I already told him everything about me. Oh God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, let me call you back. You figured it out?

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I was given up for adoption when I was born. Angelo knew I always wanted to find out where I came from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that file had your adoption papers with your birth parents’ names.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: I had tried to get them in the past, but … they’re sealed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the surprise Angelo was going to give you tonight. At your birthday dinner. The gift of knowing who your real parents are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! No! Mickey! No!

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: All units, full breach. Go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Oh God, I just killed Richard Castle!

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: I didn’t do it. It was her!

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: We need an EMT right away. Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheeseburgers!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheeseburgers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow, it worked! She dotted the ‘I’!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah! Chest!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ooh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, that hurts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, getting hit by a projectile at a thousand feet per second is gonna … sting a bit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I think it’s going to leave a mark.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All that matters is that you’re okay now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’m better than okay, Beckett. I know who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She shot you in the chest and you still think she’s innocent?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. She shot me in the chest and now I know she’s innocent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Don’t you see? Just like that vest protected me, Emma’s adoption papers? They’re protecting the killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know that made no sense, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I think what Castle is suggesting is that one of Emma’s birth parents might be behind all of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why Angelo took those records. To find one of them. What if he found one of them? Perhaps living on Overlook Road in Scarsdale? But, what if that birth parent didn’t want to be found? What if Emma learning the truth was a threat somehow?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, that’s just speculation. And if you’re right, we’ll probably never know. The killer’s most likely destroyed the records by now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Unless Angelo hid them. I mean, they were supposed to be a surprise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Head back to Angelo’s place. We need to search it again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You are aware that you don’t actually work here anymore, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Old habits.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll go grab Sully and go check again, just in case. But not because you asked me to. Because I’m actually on my way to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so, let’s suppose it is one of Emma’s birth parents. If Angelo’s murder was a setup, then how would they know how to stage it? I mean, they gave her up for adoption, so how would they know about Emma’s violent history?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Newspaper articles.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, I checked. Because she was a minor her name was withheld.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then our killer had to have had access to Emma’s sealed juvie records.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And for that you need a subpoena.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like someone skipped that step. Emma’s sealed records were opened three days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By who?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Julian Carter? Hi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m Detective Ryan. This is Kate Beckett. We’re from the Twelfth. Do you have a second to help us out with something?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Sure. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The system tagged you for opening a sealed file of an Emma Jones.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s my job. I open files, I close files. Right now I’m filing files.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m afraid so. You see, it was a juvie file, and you didn’t have the court’s permission to unseal it.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Well, I – I sometimes forget to log out of my computer, so, maybe somebody just –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just stop it. You’ve already lost your job. Now the only question is whether you’re losing your freedom, too. Because I’m about two seconds away from arresting you for accessory to murder.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. Hold on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You better start talking before he pulls out his cuffs.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Okay, okay. From time to time I slip information to a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of information?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Rap sheets, witness statements. Stuff like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about with Emma?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Three days ago the lawyer called. Said a client wanted all the information that the police had on Emma Riggs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: He didn’t say. But when I told him Emma had a juvie file under a different last name he paid me an extra grand to unseal it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s the name of this lawyer?

utterance.speaker: RAYMOND VANCE
utterance.content: No, I’m having breakfast with the judge tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hi, Mr. Vance. I’m Detective Ryan –

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: He’s a friend of a friend.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Yeah. And then –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s going to need to call you back.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: What is your problem?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, Mr. Vance, I’m not the one with the problem. You are.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Okay. I’m listening.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On behalf of a client, you paid to have Emma Riggs’ juvenile records unsealed.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Buying secured police files is illegal and grounds for disbarment. I would never do that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really? Because I have an NYPD civilian employee that begs to differ. He’s willing to testify, too.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Detective, I’m not some ambulance chaser. I’m a respected attorney at Kirkpatrick and Young. So unless you have any proof of those claims, good luck getting any court to take the word of a disgraced civilian employee.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Vance, you have a client who’s mixed up in a homicide. By withholding their name, you’re obstructing justice.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Even if I wanted to, I can’t disclose my client’s name. As you’re well aware, that falls under privileged information.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, don’t tell me we struck out on the lawyer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m afraid so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do we do now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, you guys. If we don’t figure this out, Emma is going away for life. What about her scotch bottle? Did the lab report come back?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lanie just texted. There’s no evidence of any drugs or sedatives. I’m sorry. It looks like we’re dead in the water.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, far from it. Guess what we found at Angelo’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Angelo’s birthday present to Emma. I missed it before because it was wrapped.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You want to guess what’s inside?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was – I was gonna have them guess.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: Oh, I didn’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to these adoption papers, Emma’s birth mother was a woman named Stacy Moore.

utterance.speaker: SULLY
utterance.content: She died ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And her birth father is – Espo, is this right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s right. Emma’s dad is Aaron Stokes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The real estate developer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s considering taking a run at governor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and I wonder how the governor’s mansion compares to his big house on Overlook Road in Scarsdale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And let me guess, he’s a client of Kirkpatrick and Young.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Mr. Stokes is going to be trading in his big house for the … big … house.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You ordered Aaron Stokes in for questioning? Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You told us to build our case, and Mr. Stokes is where it went.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This is a very powerful man who happens to be golfing buddies with the Police Commissioner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So because he has a standing tee time with your boss he gets away with murder?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’m handling the interview.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? No, Sir. This is our case.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes, and it’ll be your jobs if there is any blowback. I am not going let you two risk your careers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Captain, I don’t have a career to risk. How about I back you up in there?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain, I too have no career to risk. Why don’t I – maybe I should - – you know what I’m going to do? I’m going to stay here. I think you guys got this handled.

utterance.speaker: AARON STOKES
utterance.content: Why am I here? Do you know who I am?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Why do you think you’re in this room, Mr. Stokes? A room with no recording devices.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Okay. So what do you want from me?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We know that while you were married to your wife you were having an affair with Stacy Moore that produced a baby, Emma Riggs. Have you been in touch with her, Mr. Stokes?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: No, I’ve – I’ve never seen her before.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What about her boyfriend, Angelo Vazquez? Have you been in touch with him?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: No. Is Emma in trouble?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you could say that. She’s under arrest for murdering Angelo. But don’t worry. We know that she’s being framed for that murder.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Who’s framing her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you know that Angelo stole her adoption records form Saint Helena’s Home for Children?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Saint Helena’s. Stacy and I went there to make the arrangements. What was I supposed to do? Tell my wife I was having a baby with another woman? Thirty one years and not a day has gone by that I haven’t said to myself, I should try to find her. And not a day has gone by where I have then said, no, no, maybe tomorrow. It’s her birthday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You still haven’t answered my question. Did you know that Angelo stole those adoption records?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: What are you two getting at?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Look at it from our perspective, Mr. Stokes. The last thing you need right now is for some love child to emerge and destroy your marriage and any chance of running for public office.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Are you suggesting that I had something to do with this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that Angelo showed up at your home three days ago. Did you meet him then?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: I was in Chicago three days ago.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: If that is true, then why did you pay to unseal Emma’s juvenile record?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Where are you getting this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From your lawyer, Mr. Stokes.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: What lawyer?

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Okay, this is borderline police harassment. If you continue to hold me here against my will you either need to –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just wait. Before you get all lawyer-y, we already know everything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Starting with you being Aaron Stokes’s son-in-law.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, when your in-laws were out of town, you were staying at the Scarsdale house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So when Angelo went to look for Mr. Stokes, he met you instead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s when he told you the story about Mr. Stokes’ long lost daughter, Emma.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: Look – look. Yes, I stayed at my father-in-law’s house. But I’ve never seen this guy before in my life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you sure? Because, well, this is security footage from inside Angelo’s apartment building, taken about an hour after his death down at Emma’s place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now, wait a minute. Who - who is that? That … … that’s you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Using Angelo’s keys to get in. How’d you get those?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now, I can only think of one reason you’d break in to his apartment, and that would be to find Emma’s adoption records to cover up any link back to your family.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now, according to this video, you were inside the apartment searching for a good two hours. Damn. You didn’t think to look at the wrapped gift for Emma, did you? Oops. Her adoption records.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Up until then your plan was going perfectly. You spiked Emma’s scotch bottle with knockout drops and you swapped it for an empty one. It was pretty clever.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But not so perfectly to throw the dosed bottle away at your house. Yeah, we found the bottle in your recycle bin. It tested positive for chloral hydrate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oops again.

utterance.speaker: VANCE
utterance.content: All of this is circumstantial. I mean, what could possibly be my motive?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, your father-in-law helped us out with that one. Your law firm represents the Stokeses. Now, you knew they were about to transfer the majority of their wealth into a trust for their daughter. Your wife.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now, you don’t want some Little Orphan Annie coming around, making a claim for half.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s when you decided to kill the one man that knew the truth and frame it on the unknowing heir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s just one thing that we’re not so sure about.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you going to make a deal and plea to murder? Or are you going to take your chances in court?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do lawyers have lawyers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Emma?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He confessed. It’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bullet.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Right. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um, I hope you don’t mind, but someone wants to meet you.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: I am Aaron.

utterance.speaker: EMMA
utterance.content: Emma.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Happy birthday.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, nice having you back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, it was nice being back, even if it was just for one day.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Stokes. What can we do for you?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Earlier you two were only doing your jobs, but I assumed the worst and I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, how are you doing?

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: I’m not really sure. I am going to be there for Emma this time. No matter what happens at her trial, she’s not going to be alone. Well, I should leave the both of you to your work. Captain, thank you. For everything. You too, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, actually, I’m not a detective, but ...

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: You’re not?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, she should be. But your golfing buddy’s budget cuts have … gotten in the way.

utterance.speaker: STOKES
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. And to think you boys mocked me when I had this made four years ago. I think I’ll have it framed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, what does it say about your writing when your number one fan tries to kill you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was an accident.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, one inch higher and it would have been a tragedy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But on the bright side, your autographed copies of Deadly Heat would be worth way more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not funny, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Little bit funny.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know, Beckett, despite your fiancé’s near death, today was fun.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. We miss working with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. ‘cause I’m back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What – what about the Commissioner’s hiring freeze?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Stokes had a conversation with the Commissioner, and apparently he found some money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you are back. Which means … I’m back. Am – am I back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Captain Gates said that you can serve as a consultant again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But how does that – because now we’re in a – – so, do we have to hide our relationship? To keep it a secret?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the Commissioner is aware of it and said that it’s okay as long as we behave professionally in the workplace. And Captain Gates said that that can be our engagement gift.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, everybody. Listen up. Beckett is back!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And tonight at The Old Haunt, drinks are on the house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Actually, no. We can’t. Not here. It’s inappropriate. This is the workplace. We’ve gotta be professional.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, well, you know I’m not officially back until tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I see.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
